title: Singapore: Press Release
text: Singapore: Press Release United Kingdom, London, 14 September 2015 -- Tourism is very important for the economy of Singapore. It makes significant contributions to its GDP and is also significant in generating employment opportunities. Consequently, with an objective to enhance the tourist experience in this small island state, the Ministry of Trade and Industry is putting consistent efforts to increase the performance of the travel industry.In recent years, the tourism industry in Singapore has seen radical changes. Although it has always been on the top in the global list of the must visit destinations, in the past couple of years, international events such as Formula One Singtel Singapore Grand Prix as well as new ventures such as the Integrated Resorts (IRs), has further accentuated its prospects. The ratio between tourism and economy is directly proportional. The idea behind developing infrastructure and other travel-related areas is to achieve exponential growth over time. This is the reason why countries explore new avenues to attract travelers from the world over. Travel agencies also offer attractive deals on cheap air tickets to Singapore from UK. New Campaigns The Singapore Tourism Board has come up with new videos to draw international travelers. The videos are a part of the marketing campaign aimed at highlighting the newer aspects of Singapore such as the modern business districts and adventure activities. The videos, targeted at different countries, have received a positive response. Travelers are looking for cheap flights to Singapore from UK to explore the place better. The Board had earlier come up with campaigns like Uniquely Singapore, YourSingapore, Singapore Shiok and "The holiday you take home with you" and all these were a great success. Positive growth Investment in tourism infrastructure, in addition to other capabilities and amenities has contributed to a strong performance by the industry, strengthening the country’s position as a premier tourist destination. The initiatives to improve Singapore’s visibility on the world map have yielded desired results and in the near future, it has estimated that tourism will grow more than expected. The economy of Singapore will therefore continue to move up in the right proportion. About Singapore Singapore is a bustling cosmopolitan city comprising of people from different ethnicities and backgrounds. It may be small in size but otherwise it is an economic giant. The city offers a wide array of sightseeing and culinary alternatives to its visitors. A calendar full of cultural events and festivals adds to its charm. It is a flourishing country and has successful presence in the world today. Tourist Attractions Singapore has several interesting attractions for tourists, ranging from shopping malls to adventure spots. Tourists from all over book their tickets to Singapore from UK to experience the richness of this destination. Sentosa Island: This is a luxurious retreat and a leisure destination for visitors to enjoy nature and adventure. The new addition to the island is the Resorts World which is a huge complex housing the Universal Studios Theme park, shopping malls, hotels and also Singapore’s first casino. Singapore Zoo: This is one of the best zoos of India where you can see animals living in their natural habitat. The zoo can be either explored on foot or by a guided tram. It houses white tigers, proboscis monkeys, mousedeer, polar bear and many more from the animal kingdom. The place is ideal for families and kids. Jurong Bird Park: This well-maintained bird park has birds of all kinds. Hundreds of varieties can be seen here. The place is sheer bliss for bird lovers. Singapore Botanic Garden: Set in a lush green landscape, the Botanic Garden covers an area of 74 hectares. It comprises of some interesting sites such as the National Orchid Garden and Ginger Garden. Weather Singapore has a tropical rainforest climate. So the weather remains hot and humid for most parts of the year. The temperature during day time remains around 30°C, while at night it drops below 23°C. It is in the months of November till January, when temperatures go down slightly because of the Northwest monsoons. So it can be visited anytime during the year. The weather, the attractions and the MRT transport system, all seem to be ideal for any tourist destination to be successful. These are the reasons what makes Singapore stand out on the international tourism front. # # #
